intro: Irio ruderalis, commonly known as the common irio, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils, such as roadsides and fields, and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and it produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Irio ruderalis is adapted to thrive in harsh environments and is often used in traditional medicine.
